summary: This bill amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to enhance predisaster mitigation. It aims to prevent future natural disasters by prioritizing aid for high-risk, low-income, and environmental justice communities. Key provisions include increasing the federal cost-share for these communities, updating risk assessments to include climate change projections, and boosting the percentage of disaster funds available for mitigation from 6% to 15%. The bill also mandates community outreach to help vulnerable areas apply for grants and requires the creation of a central federal database to track disaster-related spending for improved transparency and anaylsis.
